required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Trampoline Exercises Children With Developmental Coordination Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Trampoline Exercises Children With Developmental Coordination Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: RCT in which 28 children with developmental coordination disorder (DCD) were enrolled and equally distributed into two groups; Participants in control group were treated with conventional physical therapy while experimental were given conventional physical therapy in addition to trampoline exercises. Assessment was at 0, 4 and 8 week using developmental coordination disorder questionnaire (DCDQ), pediatric balance scale (PBS) and peads quality of life (PQL)

primary_outcome.description: Developmental Coordination Questionnaire (DCDQ) is a scale to diagnose 5 to 15 year children with DCD and measure their developmental features but through parents reporting, Parents are asked to compare functional task and motor activity of their children with other children
Pediatric Balance Scale (PBS) is a scale used to assess child's balance. It is fourteen item scale same as Berg Balance scale.

The Peads quality of life (PQL) Measurement Model is scale for measuring health related quality of life (HRQOL) in children. It has excellent reliability of 0.88 and found measure quality of life in children ranging from healthy to chronic health conditions

arm_group.description: Jumping in place Jump and clap Jump and reach Jump and twist Jump and turn Half jumping jack Jumping side to side

Drop and catch a ball Squeeze ball between legs, jump up and catch the ball Walking on a straight line Stand on one leg try to pick object from floor without using hands (do this on both legs) Drop the ball and catch it with both hands Jump up stair with both limbs off the floor simultaneously while holding railing. Skipping.

intervention.description: Jumping in place Jump and clap Jump and reach Jump and twist Jump and turn Half jumping jack Jumping side to side Each exercise done for 1 minute, 5 repetitions is session of 1 hour 15minutes

Drop and catch a ball Squeeze ball between legs, jump up and catch the ball Walking on a straight line Stand on one leg try to pick object from floor without using hands (do this on both legs) Drop the ball and catch it with both hands Jump up stair with both limbs off the floor simultaneously while holding railing. Skipping. At least 5 repetitions for each exercise in session of total 1 hour

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Children with DCD indicated using DCDQ.
Exclusion Criteria:
- No developmental coordination disorder
- declined to participate
- Progressive unstable health condition.

reference.citation: Mitsiou M, Giagazoglou P, Sidiropoulou M, Kotsikas G, Tsimaras V, Fotiadou E. Static balance ability in children with developmental coordination disorder. European Journal of Physical Education and Sport. 2016;11:17-23.

de Oliveira IS, da Silva Oliveira D, de Azevedo Guendler J, Rocha BM, Sarinho SW. Effectiveness of motor intervention on children with Developmental Coordination Disorder (DCD): A systematic review. Journal of Physical Education and Sport Management. 2017;8(3):32-40.
